p: The Deliberative Multi-Criteria Evaluation (DMCE) has been used to incorporate multiple social values and uncertainty into decision-making processes, combining the advantages of conventional multi-criteria decision analysis methods with the benefits of stakeholder participation to provide an analytical framework for evaluating complex multi-dimensional objectives. The DMCE process also ends up functioning as a risk communication platform where scientists, stakeholders, and decision-makers can interact and discuss the uncertainty associated with biological invasions [ 55].
